abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Social Action Fund
            Project in Malawi were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) improved accountability system for
            community development is critical in order to enhance
            positive perceptions among beneficiaries, and other
            stakeholders including donors. This provides an incentive
            for their support and involvement. For this to be achieved
            there is need to strengthen the information, education and
            communication (IEC) so as to enhance civic engagement and
            community accountability. 2) The first adaptable program
            loan (APL 1) has managed to put in place proper
            accountability systems; through the APL 1, several
            innovations were made with regard to results monitoring and
            measurement. Such systems need to be maintained at each
            level of project implementation. For example, at the
            community level, there is need to promote the use of
            community monitoring and feedback through the community
            statistics days as an integral part of the monitoring and
            evaluation framework. At the local authority (LA) and
            program level, there is need to promote participatory
            development of delivery benchmarks related to the community
            sub-project cycle so that beneficiaries and stakeholders are
            aware of what they have to be accountable; and 3) the
            sustainable mechanisms to secure continuity and
            functionality of community assets and institutions
            established through the APL 1 and other similar
            interventions are important achievements for this project,
            and need to be institutionalized.
